title: Highly Porous Core-Shell Nanostructures

author: Sebastjan Nemec, Department of Synthesis of Materials, Institut "Jožef Stefan"

segmentation: Today I will talk about our about the synthetic procedure for the production of certain commercial nanomaterial that we developed on our Department.
So if we could be for a core shell, nanoparticles consist of two parts of a core and shell.
In our case, the core is supermarket paramagnetic iron oxide nanocluster, of which we heard before.
Upon this core, we depositar shell made of metropolol silica.
Assault

Apollo, Silicon, Silicon General is widely used in many applications, mostly due to the high chemical resistivity and due to the vast number of superficial hydroxyl groups enables the variety of chemical modifications and the porous types of silica, among which is the mesopause type that I have already mentioned.
Has seen a lot of use in the field of the incorporation, an transportation of substances, as we heard before already and also it connects.
Because it gets so large specific surface area, it connect as a good support for catalytic molecules.
So by having such a core shell nanoparticle, we get the combined capability becausw the magnetic iron oxide core enables.

The possibility of having a remote control capability using an external magnetic field and by having them as Apollo Silica shell, we have the ability of all the applications that I mentioned before and were mentioned in other presentations.
So it is beneficial that we have central radial orientation of the parts because in this way we have the maximum number of openings facing the outside environment.
In this way, we maximized incorporation an release of the load cargo and also we maximize the mass transport mass transfers of reagents toward catalytic sites and of product from catalytic sites.
In terms of incorporation of substances the the size of the power of the silica pearls are are crucial.
Becausw small pores limit the incorporation of small molecules of.
Large molecules such such as are big and large biomolecules, and it is still a synthetic challenge to produce a large large.
A large purse.
So the most common way to and most popular way to produce medical silica is the soft empty templating method that this method is based on.
The deposition of silica onto soft templates.

This soft templates are composed of surfactant molecules and since the silica is deposited on the outer boundaries of the soft templates, the the shape and size of the form silica ports are directly derived from the from the size and shape of the.
Templates.
And both parameters we can tune by changing the reaction conditions.
So in our work we.
Conducted to serious series of experiments firstly to achieve a good synthetic procedure to obtain high quality measure porous silica shells.

So in terms of having a great big techniques, thickness and also good porosity and after that we conducted a series of experiments to study how each individual parameter affects the properties of the form shell.
For example, if we look at the concentration of the surfactant, which is the building block of the.
Soft templates.
But changing the amount of the surfactant which changed the porosity, porosity rate of the silica by changing, for example, dbase either in terms of amount, either in terms of using.
A base with different strengths.
We achieve big differences in the thickness of the shell.
And also because of that in the sizes of the of the silica parts.
Importantly, when we add an organic solvent.
We achieve the enlargement of the purse.
This is because the nonpolar solvent is interrupt into the soft templates, and such templates become bigger and therefore also the form silica pearls become bigger.
As we can see clearly here in the experiment where we did not use any solvent in comparison with all the other experiments we were, we did use an organic solvent.
Moreover, the.
Uh, achieving different silica shell thickness is, while retaining porosity can be achieved by changing the amount of the silica precursor, which is a salon.
Here we can see.
Using less salon hiljus.
Dinner shells using more solania testicle shots.
But however here we need to be careful because after a certain amount a lot of buy produced.
Who margin homogeneous measure policy liquor form?
These are US silica only nanoparticles and these are not wanted because we don't have the extra magnetic credibility.

So we need to fine tune our reaction that we retain the selectivity of the position of silica onto the Coronado particles, so also other reaction parameters do play a role like temperature where we can see that high enough temperature enables us to achieve.
Coating, but when using higher temperatures we achieve a completely different porosity.
It's not more central radial like here, but attends the so called trash Berry shape.
So.
After starting this, we also wanted to prove the versatility of Arrow coating method to be used on other nanoparticle systems, and so we successfully formed.
Mesa follow Silica coating also on iron oxide nanoparticles which are quite smaller than nanoclusters, upon which the synthetic method was developed.
Upon the method, the iron oxide nano change that we've already seen before in the presentations and also on the barium hexafluoride nanoplatelets.
Here we see them unquoted in here with a nice measure pro silica coating.
OK, to round everything up we have developed.
Synthetic procedure that it's joinable that yields different silica with the properties that we desire.
It is important to achieve through the synthetic method slow deposition of silica towards obtaining a highly porous and highly porous and selective coating on the corner particles and also it.
It is very important to use organic solvents to achieve the enlargement of the silica pearls.
And so for the applications in the future, we would like to use synthesized on materials for specific applications.
To extend the usability.
OK.
Thank you very much.
For your attention, if you have any questions.
Thank you Sebastian for your presentation.
Questions may be from dealings.
Thank you for this nice work.
Very often, a magnetic nanoparticles are used for imaging in vitro and evil, of course.
So I wonder if you already have idea what if there are changes in key 192.
When you cluster together many magnetic nanoparticles inside the silica.
OK, so bit out of my work as far as I know.
Uh, no particles that were used for this kind of image Ng.
They were mostly single spear nanoparticles and not really silica coated.
As far as I know.
So I'm not really sure I can give you a right answer, but probably usually the coating does effect.
The the coordinate system, so probably yes.
